body_html: You are running the trivial model not resnet50. --model=resnet50 I was totally confused for a second. I recently retested and has NVIDIA test on TensorFow 1.3 and there numbers are slightly different now on the DGX-1 but no more than 3-4%. We made a few tweaks to the model as we worked to ensure it converged to match the paper. Nothing huge just small changes. You can also use the benchmarks from the staging branch but it requires 1.4. tf_cnn_benchmarks does not worry about backwards compatibility as it is kind of a sandbox, just FYI. I am working on a better way to publish updated code and accept external PRs more often. It is more work than it looks.

body: You are running the trivial model not resnet50.   ```--model=resnet50```  I was totally confused for a second.  I recently retested and has NVIDIA test on TensorFow 1.3 and there numbers are slightly different now on the DGX-1 but no more than 3-4%.  We made a few tweaks to the model as we worked to ensure it converged to match the paper.  Nothing huge just small changes.  You can also use the benchmarks from the[ staging branch](https://github.com/tensorflow/benchmarks/tree/tf_benchmark_stage) but it requires 1.4.   tf_cnn_benchmarks does not worry about backwards compatibility as it is kind of a sandbox, just FYI.  I am working on a better way to publish updated code and accept external PRs more often.  It is more work than it looks.
